entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 28 at 12:27PM MST until July 28 at 1:15PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
entry.summary:
SVRTWC
The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a
* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Cochise County in southeastern Arizona...
* Until 115 PM MST.
* At 1226 PM MST, two severe thunderstorma were located near Bisbee and Tombstone, moving north at 5 mph.
HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees.
* Locations impacted include... Bisbee, Tombstone, Elfrida, and Sunizona.
This includes the following highways... Route 80 between mile markers 314 and 350. Route 90 between mile markers 335 and 336. Route 92 between mile markers 352 and 355. Route 191 between mile markers 22 and 37.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cochise, AZ

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 3:25PM EDT until July 28 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Melbourne FL
entry.summary:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following county, Volusia.
* WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 325 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Deltona, DeLand, Orange City, Lake Helen and Cassadaga. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
entry.cap:areaDesc: Volusia, FL

cap:parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 28 at 1:18PM MDT until July 28 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton WY
entry.summary:
The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Monday afternoon through Tuesday evening.
* AFFECTED AREA: In Central WY...Fire Weather Zone 289.
* COUNTIES AFFECTED: In Central WY...Fremont...Natrona. In Southwest WY...Sweetwater.
* IMPACTS: Low humidities, warm temperatures, and gusty winds could cause erratic fire behavior.
* WIND: West 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. Wind decreases for Monday night into Tuesday morning.
* HUMIDITY: Sunday, as low as 13 percent. Monday and Tuesday, as low as 7 percent. Poor recovery Monday night into Tuesday morning.
* TEMPERATURES: Highs in the mid 80s.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Granite/Green/Ferris/Rattlesnake Mountains

cap:parameter.value: RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 3:41AM ChST by NWS Tiyan GU
entry.summary:
The tropical disturbance known as Invest 98W has drastically weakened over night. JTWC has discontinued the investigation on this disturbance. Stronger winds and heavy showers may still linger, but conditions are returning to normal for now.
Residents and mariners in Chuuk State and eastern Yap State should monitor the latest statements issued by local Emergency Management officials and keep informed with the latest forecasts. Report any wind damage, flooding or landslides to local officials for relay to the National Weather Service (NWS). More information can be found at JTWC's website www.metoc.navy.mil/jtwc/jtwc.html and the NWS Guam website at weather.gov/gum/PublicForecasts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chuuk Lagoon; Onoun; Polowat; Satawal; Woleai; Faraulep

Particulate matter levels are expected to be unhealthy for sensitive groups. For additional information, please visit the EPA AIRNOW web site at www.airnow.gov and click on Nevada.
Please note: These data are preliminary and have not been validated. Data is provided as a service from the Nevada Division of Environmental Protection and are not intended to replace medical advice. If you have questions about your health, please contact your local health department and/or your health care provider.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 1:56AM ChST by NWS Tiyan GU
entry.summary:
A Tropical Disturbance with a newly formed weak circulation, labeled as Invest Area 99W by the Joint Typhoon Warning Center (JTWC) is centered north-northwest of Pohnpei at 10N157E. Invest 99W has gradually drifted a little to the west-northwest.
Across Pohnpei, and the northwest Marshall Islands, large areas of heavy showers and isolated thunderstorms have been developing in the cyclonically curved flow around the circulation associated with 99W. Areas of heavy showers and locally gusty winds will continue over the region while 99W is nearby, probably for the next couple of days.
Also, marine conditions will be locally hazardous near heavy showers with wind gusts of 25 knots and combined seas of 5 to 8 feet at times.
Residents and Mariners in Pohnpei and the northwest Marshall Islands should monitor the latest statements issued by local Emergency Management officials and keep informed with the latest forecasts. Relay any reports of wind damage, flooding or landslides to local officials for relay to the Guam National Weather Service (NWS).
More information can be found JTWC's website www.metoc.navy.mil/jtwc/jtwc.html and the NWS Guam website at weather.gov/gum/PublicForecasts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Pohnpei; Majuro

cap:parameter.value: A TROPICAL DISTURBANCE CENTERED NEAR POHNPEI CAUSING HEAVY SHOWERS OVER POHNPEI AND THE NORTHWEST MARSHALL ISLANDS

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued July 28 at 8:00AM MDT by NWS Great Falls MT
entry.summary:
AQAMT
The Montana Department of Environmental Quality has issued an air quality alert for Deer Lodge, Granite, Ravalli, and Silver Bow counties in effect until 8AM 7/29/2024 elevated particulate levels from wildfire smoke This alert will be updated again at 800am 7/29/2024.
An Air Quality Alert means that particulates have been trending upwards and that an exceedence of the 24 hour National Ambient Air Quality Standard (NAAQS) has occurred or may occur in the near future.
As of 8AM, Particulate levels in Butte and Hamilton are Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups
When air quality is Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups... State and local health officials recommend that people with respiratory or heart disease, the elderly and children should limit prolonged exertion.
For more information visit the Montana Department of Environmental Quality at http://todaysair.mtdeq.us
entry.cap:areaDesc: Deer Lodge, MT; Granite, MT; Ravalli, MT; Silver Bow, MT

entry.summary:
ESFAFG
The Tanana River has been rising gradually over the last few days due to numerous rainfall events. The river is currently sitting at 23.55 feet in Fairbanks with action stage being 23.5 feet. The river is projected to continue rising to 23.81 feet by early next week. Outdoor recreators should pay special attention as there may be inundation of gravel bars with these water levels.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued July 28 at 5:31AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks AK
entry.summary:
ESFAFG
Previous rainfall of 1-2 inches, heaviest across the Central Brooks Range, is causing rising waters on rivers and streams including the Sag, Kuparuk, Colville, and Koyukuk, through the weekend. Fast- running streams may see very rapid rises, so outdoor recreators should pay special attention to fast moving streams as well as inundation of gravel bars.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 3:10AM CDT by NWS Brownsville TX
entry.summary:
The combination of near normal high temperatures and relative humidity percentages will result in uncomfortably warm conditions across Deep South Texas and the Rio Grande Valley today. Heat index values are expected to range between 103 and 108 degrees this afternoon and early evening. Isolated areas may briefly experience heat indices up to 110 degrees for a short period of time.
If working outside today, be sure to drink plenty of water, wear loose-fitting and light-colored clothing, and take frequent breaks in air-conditioned locations. Be sure to check on elderly and infirm neighbors and relatives, provide shade and fresh water for outdoor pets and livestock, and check the backseat of your vehicle when transporting children.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 12:30PM ChST by NWS Tiyan GU
entry.summary:
A tropical disturbance, known as JTWC Invest 98W, is west of Chuuk Lagoon at 7N149E. Currently, convection around 98W is fairly disorganized and model guidance do not favor significant tropical cyclone development, but satellite-derived products show notable vorticity signatures that are expected to sustain the unsettled weather pattern across central Micronesia. 98W will gradually track west-northwest, moving farther into eastern Yap State in the coming days.
Locally heavy showers and strong gusts are possible over Chuuk State and eastern Yap State over the next few days. Additionally, heavy weather across Pohnpei may move into Chuuk State over the next day or so.
Also, marine conditions will be locally hazardous near heavy showers with wind gusts of 25 knots and combined seas occasionally reaching 5 to 7 feet.
Residents and mariners in Chuuk State and eastern Yap State should monitor the latest statements issued by local Emergency Management officials and keep informed with the latest forecasts. Report any wind damage, flooding or landslides to local officials for relay to the National Weather Service (NWS). More information can be found at JTWC's website www.metoc.navy.mil and the NWS Guam website at weather.gov/gum/PublicForecasts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chuuk Lagoon; Onoun; Polowat; Satawal; Woleai; Faraulep

cap:parameter.value: A TROPICAL DISTURBANCE NEAR CHUUK MAY BRING GUSTY SHOWERS AND CHOPPY SEAS OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued July 27 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
entry.summary:
An Air Quality Advisory for ground level ozone has been issued by the Northeast Ohio Areawide Coordinating Agency for Ashtabula, Cuyahoga, Geauga, Lake, Lorain, Medina, Portage and Summit Counties.
The advisory is from midnight tonight to midnight Sunday night.
Air quality levels will be unhealthy for sensitive groups during this period. If you are in the sensitive groups category of children, the elderly and those with breathing difficulties, please monitor your outdoor activity and check air quality readings at airnow.gov. Additionally, sign-up at enviroflash.info for text alerts regarding air quality.
To help our region reduce air pollution:
* Drive less: bike, walk, use transit, work from home, combine trips * Visit gohiocommute.com/noaca - Find a smarter way to travel! * Don't idle - Turn off your engine * Refill your tank after sunset * Wait to mow the lawn

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued July 27 at 4:41PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks AK
entry.summary:
ESFAFG
Rainfall of 1-2 inches, heaviest across the Central Brooks Range, will cause rising waters on rivers and streams including the Sag, Kuparuk, Colville, and Koyukuk, through the weekend. Fast-running streams may see very rapid rises, so outdoor recreators should pay special attention to fast moving streams as well as inundation of gravel bars.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Western Arctic Plains; Howard Pass and the Delong Mountains; Central Arctic Plains; Central Brooks Range; South Slopes Of The Central Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Dalton Highway Summits

cap:parameter.value: Rising Waters Along Rivers Draining the Central Brooks Range This Weekend

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued July 27 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
entry.summary:
An Air Quality Advisory for ground level ozone has been issued by the Northeast Ohio Areawide Coordinating Agency for Ashtabula, Cuyahoga, Geauga, Lake, Lorain, Medina, Portage and Summit Counties.
The advisory is from midnight tonight to midnight Sunday night.
Air quality levels will be unhealthy for sensitive groups during this period. If you are in the sensitive groups category of children, the elderly and those with breathing difficulties, please monitor your outdoor activity and check air quality readings at airnow.gov. Additionally, sign-up at enviroflash.info for text alerts regarding air quality.
To help our region reduce air pollution:
* Drive less: bike, walk, use transit, work from home, combine trips * Visit gohiocommute.com/noaca - Find a smarter way to travel! * Don't idle - Turn off your engine * Refill your tank after sunset * Wait to mow the lawn

entry.summary:
The Texas Department of Environmental Quality (TCEQ) has issued an Ozone Action Day for the El Paso Area, from 8 AM to 8 PM MDT Sunday.
Atmospheric conditions are expected to be favorable for producing high levels of ozone pollution in the El Paso area. You can help prevent ozone Pollution by sharing a ride, walking, riding a bicycle, taking your lunch to work, avoiding drive through lanes, conserving energy and keeping your vehicle properly tuned. entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued July 27 at 7:45AM PDT by NWS Medford OR
entry.summary:
Oregon Department of Environmental Quality has issued an Air Pollution Advisory...until at least Monday.
The Oregon Department of Environmental Quality issued an air quality advisory for Klamath and Lake counties due to numerous wildfires burning in the region.
The wildfire smoke combined with forecast conditions will cause air quality levels to fluctuate and could be at unhealthy levels.
Smoke levels can change rapidly depending on the weather. Smoke can irritate the eyes and lungs and worsen some medical conditions. People most at risk include infants and young children, people with heart or lung disease, older adults and pregnant people.
People can take the following precautions to protect their health:
- Follow local burn restrictions to prevent deteriorating air quality. - Avoid strenuous outdoor activity during periods of poor air quality. - People with heart or lung problems and young children are especially vulnerable. These people should stay indoors while smoke levels are high. - Use certified High Efficiency Particulate Air (HEPA) filters in indoor heating, ventilation, cooling and air purification systems. - Avoid using wood-burning stoves and other sources of indoor smoke if possible.
For additional information...please visit the web site at https://oregonsmoke.org
entry.cap:areaDesc: Klamath, OR; Lake, OR

cap:parameter.value: AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PDT MONDAY

entry.title: Flood Warning issued July 26 at 4:40AM CDT until July 29 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee/Sullivan WI
entry.summary:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Wisconsin...
Rock River At Afton affecting Rock and Winnebago Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Rock River at Afton.
* WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 9.1 feet, Floodwaters affect property of a home on South Christian Road on the east side of the river in the Afton area. There is minor erosional flood damage to lowland and agricultural land in the Afton and Janesville areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM CDT Friday was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.3 feet on 05/02/1921. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
